intro: Palafoxia texana var. ambigua, commonly known as the Texas palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and roadsides.
